error.signature: reflect: call of reflect.Value.FieldByName on zero Value
error.regex: reflect: call of reflect\.Value\.\w+ on (zero|ptr|interface) Value|reflect\.Value\.Set using unaddressable value

verdict.summary: A reflect operation was called on a zero, nil, or unaddressable Value. This happens when reflecting on nil interfaces, uninitialized structs, or trying to set non-pointer values.

dead_ends.action: Use recover() to catch reflect panics and continue
dead_ends.why_fails: Catching the panic masks the root cause â€” the reflected value is wrong, so the operation never produces correct results

workarounds.action: Check reflect.Value.IsValid() before calling methods on it
Pass a pointer to reflect.ValueOf when you need to set values
workarounds.how:
v := reflect.ValueOf(&myStruct).Elem()
v.FieldByName("Name").SetString("value")  // addressable via pointer

preceded_by.condition: when a nil interface is passed to reflect.ValueOf

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'reflect.Value' panics come from the reflect package operating on invalid values, while nil pointer dereference is direct dereferencing of a nil pointer in regular Go code.
